unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Sees Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Focusing on Innovation & Sustainability**
normalised: **Automotive Sector Sees Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Focusing on Innovation and Sustainability**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive landscape is witnessing a surge in vehicle launches, reflecting a growing demand and manufacturers' commitment to innovation. From budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxury SUVs, the market offers a diverse range.
normalised: The Indian automotive landscape is witnessing a surge in vehicle launches, reflecting a growing demand and manufacturers' commitment to innovation. From budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxury S U Vs, the market offers a diverse range.

unnormalised: Dr. Anjali Sharma, Head of Automotive Research at IIT Madras, highlights the emphasis on fuel efficiency and reduced emissions. "Many companies are incorporating advanced engine technologies and exploring alternative fuel options like CNG and electric power," she stated.

unnormalised: Recently, Tata Motors unveiled its new micro-SUV, the 'Panchi,' aimed at first-time car buyers in Tier-2 cities. Meanwhile, Mahindra launched the updated Scorpio-N with enhanced safety features and a more powerful engine.
normalised: Recently, Tata Motors unveiled its new micro-S U V, the 'Panchi,' aimed at first-time car buyers in Tier two cities. Meanwhile, Mahindra launched the updated Scorpio-N with enhanced safety features and a more powerful engine.

unnormalised: The launches also showcase a growing trend towards incorporating connected car technology, offering features like remote diagnostics and real-time navigation. Maruti Suzuki's new plant in Gurugram, spanning 800 sq ft, is expected to further boost production capacity. Analysts predict these launches will contribute to a 15% growth in the automotive sector this fiscal year, with estimated revenue exceeding Rs. 50,000 Crores. Automakers are also focusing on exports to countries like Sri Lanka and Nepal. These developments are shaping the future of mobility in Bharat.
